name: Exobox Technologies
overview: Exobox Technologies Corp., a development stage company, engages in the development of enterprise and home user endpoint and server security software products in the United States and internationally. The company has developed proprietary, patented, and patent-pending software technologies, which would provide protection to the computers, networks and data. It intends to deliver a set of security products and services to enterprises, governments, small and medium-sized businesses, and consumers on a worldwide basis. Products Under Development The Exobox SECURE Solutions Suite (f.k.a. SUEZ) is a proactive, data protection solution which is under development. It focuses on data loss prevention (DLP). Exobox DLP (f.k.a. IP Tracking Module): The companyâ€™s DLP product is designed to control who could look at or alter data accessible by endpoint users and other applications providing a layer of security for an enterprisesâ€™ sensitive and confidential data. Exobox Confidential Data Discovery & Identification: Exobox / Data Discovery automatically scans the enterprise in search for critical data enabling to discover where critical data exists in an enterprise. Sources of data could be flat files, databases, structured or unstructured sources of data, emails and data created on the network (printed documents, memory sticks, and email attachments) on various devices that connect with the network. Exobox Data Audit & Reporting (f.k.a. Policy Enforcement Module): This product provides information needed for compliance reviews by providing businesses concrete evidence of who accessed or changed corporate data and IT administrators help in identifying the where-abouts of (sensitive) data. This products falls under the data life cycle management security segment. Exobox Data Access & Change Control (formerly part of SUEZ Policy Enforcement): This product controls who could look at or alter data accessible by an endpoint, such as users or other applications. Exobox Data Retention & Recovery (f.k.a. Disaster Recovery Module): This product controls how data would be phased out of use. Policy defines what happens to data after absolute or relative times, or use-based metrics, such as aggregate, archive, back up, delete, expectations related to accessing the data after archive, incremental change-based backups, web relationship backups, etc. This product falls under the data life cycle management business segment. Exobox Desktop Mobility (f.k.a. Data Stick): This product allows users to transfer his/her desktop/workspace, as well as data to various compatible computer that could run the same OS. By plugging the Exobox Data Stick into a compatible computer, the user causes that computer to replicate the userâ€™s computing environment, including clock cycles, memory, operating system, as well as the userâ€™s wallpaper, URL history, documents, Outlook contacts and other settings the user chooses. Various data changes done during the session(s) would be saved to the Exobox Data Stick. This product falls under the Mobile User segment and enables security and data protection for the Mobile user. Competition Anti-Virus: The companyâ€™s primary competitors in the anti-virus market include Symantec, McAfee, Computer Associates, Trend Micro, Sophos, Fsecure, Panda Security, and Dr. Ahnâ€™s. Network Security and Intrusion Detection and Protection: For intrusion detection and prevention products, the company competes with Cisco Systems, Computer Associates, Fortinet, Internet Security Systems, NetScreen, Sourcefire, Symantec and TippingPoint Technologies. Other Competitors: The company faces competition from technology companies, such as HP, IBM, Intel, Microsoft, and Novell. History Exobox Technologies Corp. was founded in 2002.
